chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A Colby

records.addlTxt:
3:32 PM  Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert A Colby in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Robert A Colby. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Barth states that the DE would like to plea to count 1 and is requesting a trial date on count 2. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.   Court. Court will set over sentencing. Bond is revoked.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.

10:21 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.   Defendant Robert Colby appears in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Barth is requesting a plea hearing on count 1 and a jury trial date for count 2. The State does not object to this request. Jury trial will be scheduled at the next hearing. Plea hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 3:00 pm.

State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court with Defendant Robert A Colby who appears in custody.  Clerk: PU  
  Minutes:  Atty Barth states DE is facing sentencing after revocation and requests trial be removed and hearing be set over for a status for further resolution.  No objection by the State.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert A Colby appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Defendant in custody. Intern Daniel Bernard Deida with  Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: KPD Officer Joshua Goldberg except in a professional capacity.

01:16 PM    State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Mike Barth.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.  $3000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  ts
and witness list filed by the State
